column4: Freenode uses ircd-seven-1.1.0. What package is this available as in Ubuntu Oneiric?
did you install synpatic package manager and search for ircd-seven-1.1.0 ?
didn't find it in the repositories.. perhaps it is as a different name?
well what exactly do you need it for
if you're looking for the IRC daemon, try ircd-irc2
is it different from ircd-seven-1.1.0 ?
I don't see that in the repos, you would probably have to get it from sourceforge
http://rpm.pbone.net/index.php3/stat/3/srodzaj/1/search/ircd
is this http://adipose.attenuate.org/~stephen/ircd-seven/  legit?
How can I use the RPMs?
RPM is red hat package manager, it should install with that
I need it on Ubuntu (Oneiric).
you could install smart package manager which will work with rpm's in ubuntu
Got it. http://freenode.net/seven.shtml
https://dev.freenode.net/redmine/projects/ircd-seven
so you could download the tar or add the repo
./configure; make; make install. Right?
yup
if in doubt, check the install file or instructions in the tar
Freenode is so much popular, shouldn't we have a ircd-seven package for Ubuntu? It is already GPLv2.
uh, idk, talk to developers? they must have not seen a reason to include it in repos
